intro: Cupaniopsis curvidens, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cupaniopsis, is a small evergreen shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it requires careful management to prevent spread.
